snippet.title: Kohli leading Indians close to record
snippet.content: CRICKET: A big win over Sri Lanka in the second Test in Colombo means India is one victory away from equalling the record of consecutive series successes set by Ricky Ponting's Australian between 2005 and 2008. Virat Kohli's team defeated the hosts by an innings and 53 runs to secure an unbeatable 2-0 lead in the three-match series. Ravindra Jadeja bagged his ninth five-wicket haul in Test cricket to take the Indians to their eighth Test series in a row - a run that began in Sri Lanka in 2015. The only team to have won more consecutive series is Australia, which won nine in a row under Ponting. Coincidentally, it was India that ended Australia's winning streak by taking out the 2008 Border-Gavaskar Trophy at home. The only other side to have won eight series in a row is England. That run stretched from 1884 to 1890. The Indians will not get the chance to equal Australia's nine-series run until November-December, when they face Sri Lanka on home soil. Batting first in the second Test in Colombo, India declared its first innings on nine for 622 and then dismissed Sri Lanka for 183 and enforced the follow-on, commanding a 439-run lead.
